perturbation.original_text: 11.1 AUTOMATIC RENEWAL. This Agreement will automatically renew at the end of the Initial Term or a subsequent renewal term on a year to year basis (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless either Party notifies the other at least 30 days prior to the end of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term, as applicable, of its intention not to renew this Agreement (a "Termination Notice").
perturbation.changed_text: 11.1 AUTOMATIC RENEWAL. This Agreement will automatically renew at the end of the Initial Term or a subsequent renewal term on a year to year basis (each, a "Renewal Term"), only if both Parties provide written consent to renew at least 30 days prior to the end of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term. A lack of response from either party may be interpreted as a non-renewal decision.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the contract auto-renews unless a party gives notice of non-renewal. The modified text requires affirmative consent from both parties for renewal, contradicting the original 'automatic' renewal clause.

perturbation.original_text: 13.3 TERMINATION. Upon termination of this Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing Party or destroyed unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement. The confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 13  [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of three years.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.3 TERMINATION. Upon termination of this Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing Party or destroyed unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement. The confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 13  [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall survive termination of this Agreement indefinitely, unless both parties agree to terminate the confidentiality obligations in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states confidentiality obligations survive for three years post-termination. The modified text states the confidentiality obligations survive termination of this agreement indefinitely, unless both parties agree to terminate the confidentiality obligations in writing, introducing conflicting terms.

perturbation.original_text: 16.2 NO ASSIGNMENT. Except as otherwise set forth herein, neither Party shall transfer, assign or cede any rights or delegate any obligations hereunder, in whole or in part, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent may be withheld at the other Party's reasonable business discretion; provided, however, that either Party may transfer this Agreement without prior written consent of the other Party to an Affiliate or in connection with a merger or sale of all or substantially all of the stock or assets of such Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 16.2 NO ASSIGNMENT. Except as otherwise set forth herein, neither Party shall transfer, assign or cede any rights or delegate any obligations hereunder, in whole or in part, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent may be withheld at the other Party's reasonable business discretion; provided, however, that either Party may transfer this Agreement without prior written consent of the other Party to an Affiliate or in connection with a merger or sale of all or substantially all of the stock or assets of such Party. However, either party may transfer their obligations under this agreement to a competitor of the other party, without consent, if that party ceases to be a going concern.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that consent is needed for assignment, even to an affiliate, except in specific circumstances. The modified version adds that obligations can be transferred to a competitor without consent, if the party ceases to be a going concern, contradicting the need for consent.
